content: among us crewmate stitches used u s terminology  magic_ring magic_ring  chain chain  st stitch  single_crochet single_crochet  scinc single_crochet increase  scdec single_crochet decrease  invdec invisible decrease  blo back loop only  stitches inside of parentheses are to be repeated worsted weight yarn  main body color for your crewmate any color you wish them to be  light blue and black for the visor  white for the visor accent tools  4 0 mm crochet hook  fiberfil  stitch marker  yarn needle  scissors body starting with your main yarn color round 1 magic_ring 6 or chain 2 and single_crochet 6 into the second chain from the hook 6 round 2 scinc x6 12 round 3 scinc single_crochet x6 18 round 4 scinc single_crochet 2 x6 24 round 5 scinc single_crochet 3 x6 30 round 6-17 single_crochet 30 around 30 being to stuff your crewmate round 18a first leg single_crochet 6 single_crochet into both the 7th and 23rd stitch at the same time single_crochet 1 into the next 7 stitches stitches 24-30 this will create the first leg hole continue the next rounds with this leg round 19-23 single_crochet 14 around 14 round 24 invdec single_crochet 10 invdec 12 stuff the leg being careful to not stuff it too full so that the bottom of the foot stays flat round 25 blo scdec 6 fasten_off and cut yarn leaving a tail to sew hole closed and weave in ends round 18b second leg fasten yarn to the 8th stitch from the previous round 17 single_crochet through both the 8th and 22nd stitch at the same time single_crochet in the next 13 stitches 14 repeat rounds 19-25 on the second leg stuff the remaining crewmate being careful to not overstuff the leg so that the foot will stay flat then fasten_off yarn leaving a tail to sew hole shut and weave in ends backpack using your main yarn color round 1 chain 11 starting in the second chain from the hook single_crochet 1 into the next 10 stitches rotate your work and single_crochet 1 into the next 10 stitches on the opposite side of the chain 20 round 2-9 single_crochet 20 20 slip_stitch into the next two stitches to get to the corner of the backpack fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing the backpack shut and for sewing it onto the amigurumi stuff your backpack lightly place the edges together and sew through each corresponding stitch use the remaining tail to sew the backpack onto your main body the bag should be between rounds 7 and 16 i personally just sewed the bottom edge to round 16 and the top edge of the bag to round 7 of the body weave in your ends visor switch to your light blue yarn round 1 chain 8 starting in the second chain from the hook single_crochet 1 into the next 7 stitches rotate your work and single_crochet 1 into the next
